metadata.title: CVE-2017-18249 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The add_free_nid function in fs/f2fs/node.c in the Linux kernel before 4.12does not properly track an allocated nid, which allows local users to causea denial of service (race condition) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via concurrent threads.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1040-aws - 4.4.0-1040.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1040.43').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
